content.description: An ideal fluid with density <math alttext="960 kilograms per cubic meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>960</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg/m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></mstyle></math> fills the pipe shown in the side view and flows through it. The pipe has a circular cross section, and the speed of the fluid at Point <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is <math alttext="0.6 meter per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0.6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Which of the following is most nearly the magnitude of the difference in the pressure of the fluid between points <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
